1121575597237346304.text: I'm thrilled to be a new columnist for Bloomberg, writing (occasionally) on Asia and tech. My first column is on the growing size and sophistication of the Chinese market; the huge domestic market means that China will develop leading companies.https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-04-25/china-will-ultimately-rival-u-s-in-innovation …

1120563824300523521.text: Talks between the IMF and Pakistan surrounding yet another IMF emergency lending agreement are ongoing. If concluded, this would be the 13th IMF deal that Pakistan has been forced to draw on since 1990 (and the fifth since 2000).https://www.lighthouseresearch.me/blog

1121297465280483328.text: DP World - a bellwether for GCC trade and economic activity - reported a decline of -8.8% y/y in TEU handled in UAE in Q1.

1121200326235656192.text: SocGen revisits the 'flowless rally' idea. In Q1, global equities rallied 9.6% while net outflows totaled $69bn, with most of that from European stocks ($42bn)pic.twitter.com/yAGLg2u0Pt

1121203911803596802.text:
There goes the won - down about 0.65% against the dollar after South Korea posted a surprise economic contraction with GDP shrinking the most in a decade.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-24/south-korea-economy-unexpectedly-contracts-as-investment-falters … by @ddukshialipic.twitter.com/M34HhxKbWI

A default from a China Minsheng affiliate means SBLC (Standby Letter of Credit)-structured bonds are about to get tested for the first time.

1120576429580664833.text:
Today's big idea!

For years the Fed's economic forecasts were thought to be more accurate than those of private forecasters. But Goldman Sachs finds that's no longer the case and it's changing the market's entire relationship with the central bank.https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2019-04-23/what-s-the-big-idea-the-fed-s-lost-its-forecasting-edge-video …

1118744710544183296.text: CLO exposure in the Japanese banking system is starting to become a political issue in Japan. Government officials were asked about Norinchukin's $61 billion worth of exposure.https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-18/japanese-bank-s-61-billion-clo-binge-reaches-politicians-radar …

1121576698766434304.text:
Bitcoin drops 8% after the New York AG accuses Bitfinex of covering up an $850 million loss of co-mingled client and corporate funds that they'd handed over to a Panamanian firm.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-25/bitfinex-operator-accused-by-new-york-of-850-million-coverup … by @eelarson @mattleising @olgakharifpic.twitter.com/Yx82tf4XIp

1120492914080137217.text:
Interesting new Fed paper finds govt guarantees of residential mortgages do little boost home ownership: "Thus, government guarantees could be considerably reduced, with very modest effects on the homeownership rate."

https://www.federalreserve.gov/econres/feds/files/2019027pap.pdf …

1120490025450340352.text:
More bad behavior in the direct lending space. Prosper fined $3 million for materially overstating its net returns for *almost two years.*

https://www.sec.gov/news/press-release/2019-58?hootPostID=9766bd652bbd6338e848caec411f226d …

Citigroup's 'Bear Market Checklist' model has been telling people to buy the dip for so long that some investors are asking whether it's broken.

1121610021849034755.text:
$5.9 billion has flowed into investment-grade funds in the past week, the most in about 4 years. Everyone seems to be playing catch-up in credit (Interestingly though, CCCs are still lagging behind the high-yield rally).

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-25/high-grade-bond-funds-see-biggest-influx-of-cash-in-over-4-years …pic.twitter.com/iz1R4MzeKG

1120845044326383616.text: Oil traders betting against the notion that Saudi/UAE will be able to replace lost capacity from Iran. WTI spreads soaring to the highest in the life of the contract, Brent backwardation at highest since mid October. #OOTTpic.twitter.com/ZX8RkHAFVV
